comments:

 Please let me know how to resolve these errors in eclipse 3.2.2 Thanks.


 Regards
 Sarayu.

Need some more information:

- Attach the original log file
- Does your bundle have a bundle manifest META-INF/MANIFEST.MF or only a plugin.xml.  Please provide the content.
- Do you have a constraint on org.apache.log4j (using Import-Package or Require-Bundle)?
- What VM are you using.  Your original log will have this information.

If possible a testcase to reproduce will be the most help in solving the issue.

Hi,

Thanks for the response.
Sorry for the delay.Last week I was on leave.

Now it's working fine for me and able to run my application successfully using eclipse 3.2.2 version.

I am following the below procedure to build the jars files as a plugin .
a) Select New->Project->Plugin Development->Plug-in for existing archives->Next
b) Select Add external and selected the required jars file for my application.
c) Enter the project name "***" and hit Finish

Later I came to know  a entry was missing in META-INF >> MANIFEST.MF(jars file plugin folder)

Before
======
Bundle-ClassPath: .

After
=====
Bundle-ClassPath: .
 META-INF/, (Manually Added this line)
 ***_1.0.0.jar(Manually added this line).

By adding the above two lines in META-INF >> MANIFEST.MF I am not getting the mentioned errors.

I feel that this might be the reason before why my application failed to run.

I hope this information is useful for this one.

Please let me know if any information is required.

Thanks,
Sarayu.

traces.message: Plug-in MTT was unable to load   class com.mtt.main.MTTApplication.
The activator com.mtt.main.MTTPlugin   for bundle MTT is invalid
